nl.fontys.sebivenlo.statewalker

Class ContextBase<C extends ContextBase<C,D,S>,D extends Device<C,D,S>,S extends StateBase<C,D,S>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.fontys.sebivenlo.statewalker.ContextBase<C,D,S>
  • Type Parameters:
    C - Context for this state machine. This
    D - Device for all operations
    S - State to maintain.

    public abstract class ContextBase<C extends ContextBase<C,D,S>,D extends Device<C,D,S>,S extends StateBase<C,D,S>>
extends Object
    Base class for all statewalker state machine contexts.
    Author:
    Pieter van den Hombergh <p.vandenhombergh@fontys.nl>

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ContextBase(Class<?> stateClass)
      Create a context for a state machine with states of type stateClass.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ContextBase

        public ContextBase(Class<?> stateClass)
        Create a context for a state machine with states of type stateClass.
        Parameters:
        stateClass - the class of all states.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public C initialize()
        Initialise this context. After setup, some arrangements may have to take place before this state machine can commence.
        Returns:
        this context

      • enterState

        @SafeVarargs
public final void enterState(S... state)
        Enter a specific state hierarchy. enterState adds all states listed to the current state stack and invokes the enter() method for each state. If the top most state has a history stored, that history is resumed in the same way as the states were added as per previous description.
        Parameters:
        state - states to enter.

      • addState

        @SafeVarargs
public final void addState(S... state)
        Add and invoke enter() on each state in the list. At the end of this method, the state hierarchy has "grown" with the states in the list state.
        Parameters:
        state - to add.

      • getTopState

        protected final S getTopState()
        Top state (child-most) state is the place where to enter the events.
        Returns:
        the top most (inner most/sub state most) state.

      • leaveSubStates

        public final void leaveSubStates(S state)
        Leave sub states of state, but not state itself.
        Parameters:
        state - for which the current sub-states should be left.

      • leaveState

        public final void leaveState(S state)
        Leave a state and all its sub-states in natural order.
        Parameters:
        state - to leave.

      • getDevice

        public abstract D getDevice()
        Get the device for all operations.
        Returns:
        the device

      • superState

        public final S superState(S state)
        Get the super state of a state.
        Parameters:
        state - for which the super state should be retrieved.
        Returns:
        the super (parent) state of state.

      • changeFromToState

        @SafeVarargs
public final void changeFromToState(String event,
                                                 S start,
                                                 S... endState)
        Do a full transition from a current state to a new state with optional sub-states. For the start state the leave method is invoked, for each state in endState the enter state is invoked.
        Parameters:
        event - name for the transition
        start - state to leave
        endState - states to enter in order given.

      • innerTransition

        @SafeVarargs
public final void innerTransition(String event,
                                               S start,
                                               S... endState)
        Do a transition with out leaving this state. The sub states of state are left, then the endStates are entered in the order given.
        Parameters:
        event - name for the transition
        start - state that is NOT left
        endState - new inner state.

      • logicalState

        public final String logicalState()
        Produce a string to identify the sequence or nesting of states. The NULL state is left out.
        Returns:
        a string describing the full state value of this context.

      • isDebug

        public boolean isDebug()
        Is debug set.
        Returns:
        true is debugging.

      • setDebug

        public C setDebug(boolean d)
        Set the debug flag for more debugging output.
        Parameters:
        d - flag value
        Returns:
        this context.
